alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Lake County Above 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 20 at 9:10PM MDT until May 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...HEAVY, WET SNOW EXPECTED TO CONTINUE OVERSPREADING THE SOUTHEAST AND CENTRAL COLORADO MOUNTAINS, AS WELL AS THE INTERSTATE-25 CORRIDOR, THROUGH TONIGHT CONTINUING INTO SATURDAY... .Heavy, wet snow will spread south across the central and southeast Colorado mountains, as well as the Interstate- 25 corridor, through tonight and continue into Saturday. The heavy, wet snow will have the potential to cause damage to trees and power lines. There will be large variability in total snow accumulations across the Interstate 25 corridor. Specifically, areas around Pueblo may receive only a few inches of snow, while higher elevations farther north into El Paso County and farther south into Huerfano County could locally receive over one foot of snow. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except 12 to 18 inches for the mountains as well as the Palmer Divide. * WHERE...Northern portions of the southeast Colorado mountains and mountain valleys, the Pikes Peak Region, as well as all of El Paso County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Heavy, wet snow could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight low temperatures tonight are expected to fall below freezing across El Paso County and Huerfano County. Take precautions to protect tender vegetation as well as exposed irrigation systems to prevent damage.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
